lines.text: You've reached the Szalinskis. At the sound of the beep, please leave your message, your fax, or your binary file.
Baseball's just a phase, it'll pass. But science is always cool.
You are dead meat, mister!
Gordon, you're three-quarters of an inch tall, now's not the time.
If they don't un-shrink us they will be in so much trouble!
Oh yeah? What are you going to do about it, Thumbelina?
[Climbing up a wicker chair]
This is great exercise.
Yeah. Now I've got a wicker chair I don't need to go to the gym anymore.
The kids are messy eaters, so there'll be plenty of crumbs for us to eat.
Wayne, we're not gonna spend the rest of our lives tiny; we're gonna get big again.
Diane, are you going to stay mad at me the whole time or are you going to try and make the best of this bad situation?
I'm going to stay mad at you the whole time.
[on the answering machine]
Guess what? Gordon and I got tickets to see the shuttle-launch tonight, so if that's okay, we're going to take off.

[picks up the phone]
No it isn't, Wayne. I am going on vacation this weekend. Remember?
Of course I remem... I forgot.
I am going on this vacation and nothing and NOBODY IS GOING TO STOP ME!
[Hangs up]
Boy she *does* need a vacation.
[Landing in a laundry basket]
Honey, I don't think we're using enough fabric softener.
Did Nick ever complain about Camp Isosceles?
He sure did. He *hated* it. He didn't like the fact that it lasted only six weeks instead of eight.

[under his breath]
Brain-box.
What's the record-player?
That old CD player.

[greeting her and the robot-dog]
Hey, Tina. Hey, Trowser.
Say hello, Trowser.

[barking]
Hello - hello.
"Hello"?
Turns out, that's what "woof" means.
So, here we are. This is the kitchen.
Good, 'cause you know, I really wanted to be alone with you.
[sets his hand on the counter near Diane and Patti]

[looking at Ricky's fingers in disgust]
Ew, look, dirty fingernails.
Really?
Yeah, 'cause the truth is, Jenny, I think you're awesome.
Awesome? Don't fall for it, Jenny. He's just giving you a line.
You do? You think I'm awesome?
Oh, yeah. You're cooler than all the other girls.
[Diane and Patti stare at each other confused]

[in a serious tone]
So, um, what is it you wanted to tell me?
Nothing. Mostly, I just wanted to do this.
[takes Jenny in his arms and kisses her on the lips]
What is she doing? She's too young. She doesn't even know that boy.
[Jenny breaks the kiss]
What are you doing?
Kissing you.
Well, you didn't ever ask.
Ask what?
Ask if I wanted to kiss you.
What are you talking about?

You just assumed that I wanted you to kiss me. I mean, I don't even know you, and even if I did know you and we talked and you got to know me and you asked me if I wanted to kiss, I might have been into it, but the way you did it was just... wrong.
Well, lots of girls like that.
Well, I'm not one of them. I don't happen to feel that way, and as far as you and I are concerned, the party is over.
[exits the kitchen]
You tell him, Jenny! Access denied!
That is one good kid you have.
And you know what? She can take care of herself.
